intro: Vellozia tomeana, commonly known as the red-flowered vellozia, is a striking member of the Xanthorrhoeaceae family native to South Africa. It is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves and its showy, red or orange inflorescences that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
